quiz.title: Chemistry: Unit 2 Quiz 1
quiz.subtitle: 2.1: Definition of Matter and Physical Properties
quiz.subject: Chemistry

questions.question: Which of the following is an 'extensive' physical property?
questions.explanation: Extensive properties depend on the amount of matter present. Mass increases as you add more of the substance.

questions.question: Which property describes a substance's resistance to flow?
questions.explanation: Viscosity is the measure of a fluid's resistance to gradual deformation by shear stress or tensile stress (thickness).

questions.question: The temperature at which a liquid turns into a solid is its:
questions.explanation: The freezing point is the physical property describing the temperature threshold for the liquid-to-solid transition.

questions.question: A substance that can be hammered into thin sheets without breaking is said to be:
questions.explanation: Malleability is a physical property common in metals like gold and aluminum.

questions.question: Which of the following is calculated using the formula $D = \frac{m}{V}$?
questions.explanation: Density is the ratio of mass to volume and is a characteristic intensive property of a substance.

questions.question: Which of these is an example of an 'intensive' physical property?
questions.explanation: Intensive properties do not change regardless of how much of the substance you have.

questions.question: Solubility is defined as:
options: The ability of a substance to burn.
The ability of a substance to dissolve in a solvent.
The speed at which a substance reacts with acid.
The shine or reflection of light off a surface.
questions.explanation: Solubility is a physical property describing how well a solute can dissolve in a specific solvent at a given temperature.

questions.question: If you cut a copper wire in half, which property remains the same?
questions.explanation: Conductivity is an intensive property; the identity of the material hasn't changed, so its ability to conduct electricity remains the same.

questions.question: Which property refers to the ability of a material to be drawn into a thin wire?
questions.explanation: Ductility is the physical property that allows a solid (usually a metal) to stretch under tensile stress.

questions.question: True or False: Observing a physical property changes the chemical identity of the substance.
questions.explanation: False. Physical properties can be measured or observed without changing the composition of the matter.
